discussion.content: Correct answer should be A

Selected Answer: B
The description of Log Insight

Tricky one. Network insight has a good display and it specialized for NSX-T, but it is not real-time monitoring tool Log insight can provide real-time alert. if it configure custom config. both tool can query and display graphically. I will go B.

Selected Answer: B
I think B is good:
https://www.vmwarebits.com/sites/default/files/files/ConfiguringvRealizeLogInsightforNSX-T.pdf

A. vRealize Network Insight can capture an audit information of NSX objects quickly from the NSX-T Manager and NSX-V Manager. The information includes the user name who created or modified the NSX object, when the operation happened and the operation details on the object.

Selected Answer: B
https://www.vmware.com/content/dam/digitalmarketing/vmware/en/pdf/downloads/eula/vmw-vrealize-log-insight-cloud-service-description.pdf

Selected Answer: B
B - >The NSX-T Log Insight Content Pack provides for additional collection,
consolidation, and correlation of NSX log data. This graphically rich
content pack contains 7 dashboards and 52 widgets used to represent
the NSX-T logs graphically and make them more intuitive and actionable.
The content pack covers NSX-T functions such as audit information,
logical switch, logical router, firewall traffic, DHCP. NSX-T administrators
can view issues related to communication between different NSX
components. The logs include audit information, errors, configuration
and traffic patterns. This content pack provides last mile troubleshooting
to complement the monitoring and troubleshooting capabilities of vRealize
Network Insight and vRealize Operations.

I am going with B (Log Insight) 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Log-Insight/8.8/com.vmware.log-insight.administration.doc/GUID-52D05883-DD58-4804-A607-2BFDA54BAA57.html

Selected Answer: A
I think A is correct.
lOG iNSIGHT

questions.question_text:
Which VMware solution provides customers with the ability to query and graphically display activities for audits, events and custom real-time alerts for the VMware
NSX-T firewall running in VMware Cloud on AWS?

Standard security practice for a company requires that all administrator-level user accounts have their passwords changed every 60 days. The cloudadmin@vmc.local account password is changed by an administrator through the VMware vSphere Cliento adhere to the security policy. When the administrator attempts to log into the VMware Cloud on AWS vCenter Server through the VMware vSphere Client a few days later as cloudadmin@vmc.local using the account credentials copied from the VMware Cloud console, the administrator's access is denied. What is the likely cause of this issue?

choices.A: The cloudadmin@vmc.local account password should not be changed through the VMware vSphere Client. In order to prevent unauthorized access to VMware Cloud on AWS by non-authorized individuals, VMware will lock the account out.
choices.B: When the password for cloudadmin@vmc.local is updated from the VMware vSphere Client, the updated password is not reflected in the VMware Cloud console.
choices.D: The cloudadmin@vmc.local account password should only be changed through the appliance management interface of the VMware vCenter Server.
choices.C: The cloudadmin@vmc.local password change confirmation email has not been approved by an Organization Owner.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vmc-aws-operations/GUID-7F72EA90-5BFA-404F-A2EC-B93070A52A67.html

Selected Answer: B
B is it.

I agree with B , you change the cloudadmin password in vSphere Client and it needs to synch 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vmc-aws-operations/GUID-7F72EA90-5BFA-404F-A2EC-B93070A52A67.html

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

questions.question_text: An administrator is reducing a five-node cluster down to four. What happens to all virtual machines (VMs) when a host is removed from a cluster?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
VMs migrate when a host is deleted.

comments.content: Also to remove a Host from a cluster you need to put it in Maintenance Mode (which will migrate the VMs off the host)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I agree with C , if you are removing the host you need to migrate the VM's to another host.

choices.A: All VMs on the host being removed are deleted.
choices.C: All VMs are migrated from the host.
choices.D: All VMs are unregistered from VMware vCenter.

questions.answer_description:
When you remove a host from a cluster, its resources are deducted from the total resources of the cluster. The state of the virtual machines deployed on the host determines whether they are migrated to other hosts within the cluster.
Reference:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/5.5/com.vmware.vsphere.vcenterhost.doc/GUID-D3FC9B42-1075-4A28-9C3C-34BE67F385ED.html

questions.question_text:
An administrator is tasked with migrating workloads from one of the company's primary data centers to VMware Cloud on AWS. The migration of these workloads must meet the follow criteria:
✑ Must have zero downtime
✑ Must be organized based on service-level agreement (SLA)
✑ Should not communicate with the on-premises gateway
Which three VMware HCX features would meet these requirements? (Choose three.)

comments.content: But MON keeps it from using the local gateway which is a requirement. I’m going with A,B,C.

discussion.content:
B,C,E
Bulk migration is disruptive and App Path Resiliency is to optimize traffic.

A, B, C
You can't have MON enabled without Network Extension

Selected Answer: ABE
Bulk migration make downtime, App Path Resiliency is only to optimize traffic.
Else C or E is hard to choose.

Selected Answer: ABE
Agree with Rabbit

A,B,C. You need MON for the gw requirement. RAV can do large sets (which you can organize however you want… by SLA in this case) and to use MON and to have a nondisruptive cut over, you need network extension for L2 stretch.
I go ABC

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC:
Must have zero downtime = Replication-Assisted vMotion
Must be organized based on service-level agreement (SLA) = Replication-Assisted vMotion (you can schedule the switch over base on SLA)
Should not communicate with the on-premises gateway = Mobility Optimized Networking & Network Extension.

comments.content: I agree with A B E

discussion.content: Bulk Migration is incorrect - it clearly states NO DOWN in the question and in the definition of Bulk Migration above it has"downtime similar to a reboot"

Selected Answer: ABE
A. Mobility Optimized Networking will avoid using the on-prem gateway.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-HCX/4.3/hcx-user-guide/GUID-D06ABBEE-CF8D-4506-A5DC-61B63D9B9EE5.html
B. Replication Assisted vMotion allows for live migration of a large number of VMs.
https://blogs.vmware.com/cloud/2019/08/08/hcx-enterprise-replication-assisted-vmotion/
E. Mobility Groups allows for migration based on business requirements.
https://blogs.vmware.com/cloud/2020/01/10/vmware-hcx-adds-mobility-groups-simplify-workload-migration-easily-identify-group-plan-migrate-complex-applications/

questions.question_text: Which method can be used to deploy a VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
APIs win the day.

Selected Answer: C
C is ok !

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

C
API
VMware Cloud on AWS API (1)
SDDC management actions are available in the VMware Cloud on AWS API. This API is the endpoint for most actions that are configured in the VMware Cloud on AWS SDDC console. Example actions include:
• Creating or removing SDDCs with a single API call 
• Adding or removing the elastic hardware provided by the VMware Cloud on AWS service 
• Adding or removing ESXi hosts to your SDDC 
• Handling network operations for the SDDC
• Gathering task-based information on actions and items in the VMware Cloud on AWS environment
Many of the actions performed in the SDDC console are available in the VMware Cloud on AWS API
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
I agree with amit88, C is correct.

Rest API
https://aws.amazon.com/vmware/features/

You can quickly create new VMware SDDC clusters on AWS Cloud through a web-based console or by utilizing a RESTful API. VMware manages and operates the service including VMware SDDC software components and the modern web-based console.

Selected Answer: A
https://vmc.techzone.vmware.com/resource/sddc-management-powercli#section1
